subject_terms_3: Indian sculpture/ sculpture?  Religion and Philosophy
physical_appearance: This is a copper plate that has been cut out in the silhouette of a Jina. Standing straight with arms by his side, long prominent ears, the sculpture ends with a finial at the top.
sgcool_label_text: The Siddhapratima Yantra, meaning magical diagram depicting a perfected being, shows the silhouette of a Jina from the Digambara sect of Jainism. It is cut out of a copper plaque which is stele-shaped with a stepped base, the usual style of a sculpture, except there is a space where the figure would be. This type of image is a way of showing a formless form. It denotes the ultimate transcendence of the perfected being.
subject_terms_1: Jainism  figurative art  religious symbolism  Jainism
subject_terms_2: Religious articles  Copperwork  Sunyata  Figurative art Jainism
